data.title: Who Makes up the C-Suite Team of Apple: Meet the Executives [2024]
data.meta_description: Apple Inc is a highly renowned American multinational company that primarily designs and develops personal computers, tablets, smartphones, and other
data.text:
Apple Inc is a highly renowned American multinational company that primarily designs and develops personal computers, tablets, smartphones, and other related services. Apple’s best-selling products include Macintosh computers, iPhones, and iPods. The technology company also offers Apple customers the Mac OS X operating system, iTunes, iLife, and iWork suite. Apple Inc, previously Apple Computer Inc, was co-founded by Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak in 1976. In 2007, the executives dropped the word “Computer” from the company’s name to hint at its expansion into the consumer electronics segment.

With the philosophy of designing high-end, sleek, aesthetic, durable, and reliable technology products, Apple emerged as the top technology company in the consumer electronics industry. Apple Inc is now considered a trusted technology company because of its cutting-edge innovation and design excellence. Behind the success of Apple, a team of C-suite executives lies who work tirelessly to oversee the organization’s worldwide operations and drive strategic decisions to accelerate the organization’s rapid growth.

Who Makes up the C-Suite Team of Apple Inc: Meet the Executives [2024]

1. Tim Cook – CEO

Tim Cook has been Apple Inc.’s CEO and board of directors since 2011. Before being appointed as chief executive officer of this American multinational company, he was COO at Apple and was responsible for handling Apple’s global sales and operations along with supply chain, sales processes, customer service, and support. He also led the Macintosh division of Apple and contributed a vital role in developing strategic reseller and supplier relationships by ensuring flexibility in company responses based on the rising demand of the consumer market. Before joining Apple Inc, Tim was VP of corporate materials at Compaq, responsible for handling procurement and management activities of Compaq’s products. Tim was also appointed in Intelligent Electronics as COO for the reseller division and in IBM for various leadership roles, including director of North American fulfillment. Apple CEO holds a BS in industrial engineering from Auburn University and MBA from Duke University.

Related: Who Makes up the C-suite Team of Google

2. Jeff Williams – COO

Jeff Williams is the chief operating officer (COO) at Apple Inc, responsible for overseeing the company’s worldwide business operations, customer service, and support. Jeff also leads and directs Apple’s design team and software and hardware engineering processes for Apple watches. Other job roles of Apple COO include advancing medical research and pioneering the latest technological solutions to empower the workforce to manage their health and fitness efficiently. Williams has played a vital role in strengthening Apple’s position in the smartphone market by successfully launching several series of iPhones. Jeff joined Apple in 1998 as head of a worldwide procurement job role and later got promoted to several leadership positions. Before joining Apple Inc, he worked at IBM Corporation for 13 years in several roles. Jeff earned his MS in ME from North Carolina State University and his MBA from Duke University.

Related: Who Makes up the C-suite Team of Tesla

3. Carol Surface – CPO

As chief people officer of Apple, Carol Surface is responsible for handling matters related to connection, development, and care for Apple’s workforce. Carol’s team oversees processes related to onboarding new talents, workforce development, employee relation, benefit, compensation, inclusion, and diversity. Before joining Apple, she spent around ten years in Medtronic, serving as EVP & CHRO. Carol Surface also worked as EVP & CHRO of BestBuy. She served in a variety of international human resource-related roles at PepsiCo. Carol went to Castleton University to earn her bachelor’s in psychology and Central Michigan University to earn a doctorate in industrial and organizational psychology.

Related: How to Reinvent Your Life After the C-Suite

4. Luca Maestri – SVP & CFO

Luca Maestri is SVP and CFO of Apple, managing the company’s accounting, financial planning, business support, treasury, and investor relation-related matters. Luca joined Apple Inc in 2013 as a VP of finance and corporate controller and was later promoted to various finance leadership roles. Apple’s CFO brings over 25 years of extensive experience developing and leading finance teams in the world’s top organizations. Before joining Apple, he was a chief financial officer at a firm that provides digital print technology, Xerox, and leading communication service provider, Nokia Siemens Networks. He commenced his professional career by joining General Motors, where he spent around twenty years and served in various financial and operating roles. Later Luca also became the CFO of General Motors to oversee the company’s operations in over 45 countries with a net revenue of $40 billion. Maestri earned his bachelor’s degree in economics from Luiss University and MS in management from Boston University.

Conclusion

Apple’s C-suite team comprises highly experienced, diversified, and focused executives who drive innovation, organizational excellence, and financial success. With the world’s renowned leaders like Tim Cook as CEO, Luca Maestri as CFO, Carol Surface as CPO, and Jeff Williams as COO, Apple Inc. continues strengthening its position in the market as a global technology giant and preparing it for future endeavors.
